column4: Seeing as folks are coming and going, I hope no one takes offense if I re-post my original question...
that's okay if you've left at least 10 minutes
Installed ubuntu-restricted-extras, seems to not have changed anything...
disregard, I have another thing to try.
try loading an mp3 file into totem. It should offer to download codecs for you.
failing that, use the medibuntu repository and install w32codecs (or w64codecs if you're on 64bit)
yep, that's what I'm doing right now
=/ and failing both restricted-extras and w32codecs... what now?
try loading an mp3 file into totem?
or just 'cat file.mp3 >/dev/audio'. Mind you, you will have to train your brain to do the MP3 decoding.
the song loads, loads the data, says 0:00/time... and just doesn't play.
heh. I'd rather watch youtube recordings.
tried mplayer? It tends to at least give some meaningful error output.
perhaps it's something stupid and you just have to (gasp) reboot
meh, been having this issue for a while. Amarok was the only player that's worked.
